page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The area is quite rural.There are a lot of farms.There is not much housing in the area.There is some on the outskirts of Coventry and some on the edge of Kenilworth.One of the most outstanding features is the University. It is very modern.The industrial estates are in Kenilworth.One is in Common Lane. It is around 30 years old.It has not got a very pleasant atmosphere.It is noisy and dirty.The other estate is in Prince's Drive. It is much newer. It is also much cleaner and quieter.The most well known wood is Crackley Wood. It is very big. There are 4 schools.There are no major shopping centres. There are no rivers but several small streams which run into the River Avon. Remnants of the Forest of Arden can be seen as small deciduous woods.
